headline: Why JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, and American Express Plunged Today
summary: Shares of major financial companies JPMorgan Chase (NYSE: JPM), Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC), and Warren Buffett holding American Express (NYSE: AXP) were all down significantly on Monday, falling 3.8%, 5.1%, and 2.9%, respectively, as of 12:04 p.m. ET.  Uncertainty over Trump's tariff policy has recently led to recession or stagflation fears; over the weekend, Trump declined to rule out tolerating a recession as a result of the protectionist policies.

raw.headline: Why JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, and American Express Plunged Today
raw.summary: Shares of major financial companies JPMorgan Chase (NYSE: JPM), Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC), and Warren Buffett holding American Express (NYSE: AXP) were all down significantly on Monday, falling 3.8%, 5.1%, and 2.9%, respectively, as of 12:04 p.m. ET.  Uncertainty over Trump's tariff policy has recently led to recession or stagflation fears; over the weekend, Trump declined to rule out tolerating a recession as a result of the protectionist policies.

headline: AmEx Enhances Card Capabilities With Center Acquisition
summary: AXP announces the acquisition of Center in a bid to enhance its commercial card offerings.

headline: American Express to buy expense management software firm Center
summary: Subject to customary closing conditions, the acquisition is anticipated to close within the second quarter of this year.

headline: Amex to buy expense manager Center to bolster offerings
summary: The deal will allow the banking and card network behemoth to expand its expense management and accounting functions for business travel.

raw.headline: Amex to buy expense manager Center to bolster offerings
raw.summary: The deal will allow the banking and card network behemoth to expand its expense management and accounting functions for business travel.

headline: The new Trump era just got more complicated for Capital One
summary: Capital One now has to defend itself against a new lawsuit from a company owned by President Donald Trump while also seeking a big merger approval from Trump’s antitrust enforcers.

raw.headline: The new Trump era just got more complicated for Capital One
raw.summary: Capital One now has to defend itself against a new lawsuit from a company owned by President Donald Trump while also seeking a big merger approval from Trump’s antitrust enforcers.
